intro: Touterea stricta, commonly known as the silver fern, is a striking tropical plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the fern family (Polypodiaceae) and is characterized by its distinctive, metallic sheen leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often near streams or in forest understories. Its fronds are evergreen and can reach lengths of up to 1.5 meters. The silver fern is not only ornamental but also holds cultural significance in Māori traditions.
